column4: anyone else stumbled upon the pydoc mess upoin the last update?
python programmers aroung?
a lot of them in #python
I'm there as well, but my question is not python related, but ubuntu related. Last apt-get update broke my python installation
in what way?
now help(command) doesn't work (and yesterday, before the upgrade did)
in fact pydoc got messed up
what version did it update to?
I'm running that and it works.  You are using breezy?
it works help(list) for instance?
or running pydoc from the commandline?
yes to both
crap, then what can be the problem... have you updated lately? :)
yep, up to date
no idea on the problem, what happens when you try pydoc?
http://pastebin.com/602660
to any help command, and pydoc from command line.. all the same exception
hrmm, have you tried reinstalling it?
nope... any other hint?
nope as in reinstall didn't work or nope as in you didn't try yet?
nope as in I haven't tried it yet.. I tend to save reinstsalling as a last resource... else I feel like I'm under windows all over again ;)
well sudo apt-get install --reinstall python python2.4, won't really hurt you any
reinstall didn't help!!!
don't know what would cause that... did google turn up anything with the errors?
